description.plain:
Charlotte Emma Aitchison (born 2 August 1992), known professionally as Charli XCX, is an English singer-songwriter known for her eclectic style. She began making music at fourteen, and her debut release was a 2008 limited-edition album aptly titled 14.

By 2010, Charli signed to Atlantic Records, and released her debut single “Stay Away” in May 2011. She released her “real” debut album, True Romance, in 2013. The record met critical acclaim but failed to attain much commercial success. Charli’s true breakthrough came with the release of hit collaborations like Iggy Azalea’s “Fancy” and Icona Pop’s “I Love It.”

In April 2014, Charli found solo success with “Boom Clap,” which was featured on the soundtrack of The Fault in Our Stars. It’s now certified triple platinum in the United States and gold in her native United Kingdom. Her sophomore album, Sucker, was a pop-punk oriented effort and enjoyed more success than her debut. “Break The Rules,” “Doing It” (featuring Rita Ora), and “Famous” all performed well on the UK singles chart.

By 2015, Charli began work on a third studio album, teaming up with PC Music artists and affiliates such as SOPHIE, Danny L Harle and A. G. Cook to create harsher, more electronic music. Critics hailed the Vroom Vroom EP as a groundbreaking new form of pop. Despite this, her record label was dissatisfied with how the singles were performing: “After the Afterparty” and “Boys” both reached the UK Top 40 but had little success elsewhere.

Defying her label’s commercial expectations, she released two “mixtapes” in 2017: Number 1 Angel and Pop 2, which featured collaborations with the likes of MØ, ​CupcakKe, Carly Rae Jepsen, and Tove Lo. Critics again reacted positively to these releases, with the latter attaining an 84 score on Metacritic.

Throughout 2018, she released a handful of singles, including formerly-unreleased fan favorites “Girls Night Out” and “No Angel,”. From May to August, Charli joined pop superstar Taylor Swift on her reputation Stadium Tour, introducing her to a whole new audience.

The following summer, she released a 15 song self-titled album, featuring many previous collaborators. Notable new collaborators for the project included Troye Sivan, Big Freedia, Planet 1999, Christine and the Queens, and Lizzo.

In 2020, she recorded a new project almost entirely during the first few months of the Covid-19 global pandemic: how i’m feeling now. The project was created largely with the help of Cook and Bon Iver producer BJ Burton. A documentary about the project’s recording, called Alone Together, premiered at SXSW the following spring.

songs.full_title: Boys by Charli XCX
songs.title: Boys

description.plain:
On her 2017 single “Boys,” Charli XCX has kind of a one-track mind. She told Glamour, “It’s just about dreaming about boys, basically.” “Boys” is one of the rare songs in Charli’s catalog that she didn’t have a hand in writing. It was penned by four boys and two girls: Emily Warren, Ingrid Andress, Cass Lowe, Michael Pollack, Ari Leff, and Jerker Hansson.

In July 2017, the Internet was busy thinking about the “Boys” music video. Co-directed by Charli, the clip features 60 famous dudes acting like video vixens. “The song ‘Boys’ is basically about dreaming about all the cuties out there in the world,“ Charli told Dazed. "The video—it’s about making boys the ‘sexy’ part of a pop video for once, instead of the girls.”

description.plain:
“Boom Clap” is one of the first singles for the Fault In Our Stars soundtrack. Originally written for Hilary Duff, but Charli was told it wasn’t cool enough…

The song’s bass interpolates Natalia Kills’s “Saturday Night”. Check out the sample below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cnD_efmM6s#t=25

songs.full_title: Vroom Vroom by Charli XCX
songs.title: Vroom Vroom

description.plain:
“Vroom Vroom” is the title track from British pop rebel Charli XCX’s Vroom  Vroom EP. During the premiere of “Vroom Vroom” on Beats 1 Radio, she said, “I really want to put Paris Hilton in the video.”

Charli XCX worked with left-field British electronic producer SOPHIE for the four songs on the Vroom Vroom EP. She played the song for the first time during a DJ set in early 2015. SOPHIE is known for her involvement in London-based record label and collective PC Music. Charli said the following about their collaboration:

Sometimes we get aggressive, sometimes we get beautiful—she pushes me and I push her. I’m making beautiful party songs right now and this is just the start.

“Vroom Vroom” is also the name of Charli’s new experimental pop label.

songs.full_title: After the Afterparty by Charli XCX (Ft. Lil Yachty)
songs.title: After the Afterparty

description.plain:
Charli XCX’s “After The Afterparty” is the first single from her upcoming third studio album. On the track, which features Atlanta rapper Lil Yachty, she sings about partying all day, every day, and gives a shout-out to fellow party girl Rihanna. Charli XCX previously teased the song on Twitter using a string of emojis:
https://twitter.com/charli_xcx/status/784466069079687169
She premiered the lyrics on Genius. She also told Fader she wanted “to make the best pop album of 2017.” This is the first taste of her journey toward achieving that pop domination.

description.plain:
“Unlock It” is the bubbling eighth track off Pop 2, featuring Korean rapper Jay Park and German pop singer Kim Petras.



In an Instagram post celebrating its release, Charli said of its hook:

I remember coming up with the lock it lock it lock it part whilst I was in a car driving to New Jersey for a show on the Halsey tour. I had it in my head all day and I kept singing it over and over.

songs.full_title: ​forever by Charli XCX
songs.title: ​forever

description.plain:
“forever” is a love ballad directed toward Charli’s current boyfriend Huck Kwong. The song shows how she wants to be in his life forever, even if they eventually drift apart. The song, according to Charli, also addresses the difficulties of the two’s long distance relationship, but maintains how she still feels as strongly as ever for him.

The song was first teased by Charli with a tweet of a screenshot of messages sent to producer BJ Burton. The message Charli sent BJ said:

Ok sick, first song I wanna put out is forever either on April 10th or possibly more realistically on April 13th

She shared a tweet previewing the track’s instrumental the next day and showed some of its lyrical contents in an Instagram live session later that day. It was later  premiered by Annie Mac on BBC Radio 1.

songs.full_title: ​claws by Charli XCX
songs.title: ​claws

description.plain:
“claws” is the second single from Charli XCX’s 2020 quarantine project how i’m feeling now.

The track was first teased by Charli with lyrics she posted to her Twitter on April 8, 2020. She later played a vocal demo of the track on Instagram Live session on April 10, 2020, also revealing that Dylan Brady of 100 gecs produced the track.

Charli revealed that the track’s instrumental was tentatively called “Claws” in the same Instagram Live session. Charli took to Twitter to ask fans to help decide the song’s name and ended up sticking with “claws” on April 13, 2020.

description.plain:
“Click” is the fifth song from Charli XCX’s 2019 record Charli, featuring German singer Kim Petras and Estonian rapper Tommy Cash.

In Pitchfork’s August 2019 cover story on XCX, “Click” was described as “riotous”, and that it

ends with a beat that sounds like monster trucks having sex.

XCX first collaborated with both artists on her 2017 mixtape Pop 2, on tracks “Unlock It” and “Delicious”. She also appeared on Cash’s 2018 record ¥€$, lending backing vocals to the track “COOL 3D WORLD”.

songs.title_with_featured: Blame It on Your Love (Ft. Lizzo)

description.plain:
“Blame It on Your Love” is the second single from Charli XCX’s third album, Charli. After its initial recording in 2016-2017, the track was entirely re-worked by producers A. G. Cook, Life Sim, and Lil Data, and was released as “Track 10” on her 2017 mixtape Pop 2.

The non-reworked version of the track features production from frequent collaborators EASYFUN and StarGate, with a guest verse from Lizzo. XCX officially announced the track via Twitter on May 14th:
https://twitter.com/charli_xcx/status/1128338220779835392

The song premiered the next day on BBC Radio 1.

Multiple demos of the track have leaked, one of which includes vocals from an unknown male singer; another features UK rapper Stefflon Don.

songs.full_title: 2099 by Charli XCX (Ft. Troye Sivan)

description.plain:
“2099” is the last song on Charli and the futuristic sequel to Charli XCX and Troye Sivan’s first-ever collaboration “1999”, released just under a year before, in October 2018. “2099” followed up on September 10th, 2019, only days prior to the release of Charli’s eponymous third album.

The track was first performed in June 2019 during Charli’s set at the first annual “Go West Fest” – an LA-based festival celebrating Pride month.

On September 8th, 2019, XCX posted a picture of herself and Troye on the set of the track’s music video, which was released September 18th. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qcNt-sNB4_s

songs.full_title: Shake It by Charli XCX (Ft. Big Freedia, Brooke Candy, ​cupcakKe & Pabllo Vittar)
songs.title: Shake It
songs.title_with_featured: Shake It (Ft. Big Freedia, Brooke Candy, ​cupcakKe & Pabllo Vittar)

description.plain:
“Shake It” is a song from a long-delayed and very anticipated third studio album Charli by English singer-songwriter Charli XCX. The song was written by XCX, along with American rappers cupcakKe and Brooke Candy, Brazilian singer and drag queen Pabllo Vittar and American musician Big Freedia.



This is first collaboration between Charli and Big Freedia, but the third between Charli, Pabllo Vittar and cupcakKe.



Brooke Candy, cupcakKe and Pabllo Vittar are featured on the song “I Got It” from Charli’s mixtape Pop 2. Charli also provided guest vocals for Pabllo’s “Flash Pose,” a lead single from her EP 111.



Aside from her guest spots on “I Got It” and “Shake It,” cupcakKe was also featured on Charli XCX’s 2017 mixtape Number 1 Angel on the track “Lipgloss”.



“Shake It” is Brooke Candy’s fourth collaboration with Charli. The previous three being “Cloud Aura,” a song which first appeared on Charli’s 2012 mixtape Super Ultra and then on her debut album True Romance, “I Got It” from Pop 2, and the latest “XXXTC” from Brooke’s debut album. Brooke also appeared in David Guetta’s music video for “Dirty Sexy Money”. The video was co-directed by Charli, who also featured on the track alongside rapper French Montana. Charli also co-wrote Brooke’s 2018 song “My Sex”.

songs.full_title: Track 10 by Charli XCX
songs.title: Track 10

description.plain:
“Track 10” is a remix of the previously unreleased song “Blame It On Your Love,” making it the only song on the project that wasn’t specifically made for this mixtape. Confusingly, the original track was later remixed with a feature from Lizzo and released as a single in May 2019.

In an interview with E Weekly, Charli said:

I also love the song “Track 10,” which is something that’s been around for awhile, but we made this new version of it.

songs.full_title: February 2017 by Charli XCX (Ft. Clairo & Yaeji)
songs.title: February 2017

description.plain:
‘'February 2017’‘ is a song from English singer-songwriter Charli XCX’s long-delayed and highly anticipated third studio album, Charli. The song was written with and features Korean-American singer-producer Yaeji and American singer-songwriter Clairo.

In “February 2017,” Charli is asking a lover to forgive her for breaking their heart, and explains the loneliness and emotional turmoil she is experiencing as a result of their anger with her. The song is likely inspired by Charli’s on-and-off relationship with her boyfriend Huck Kwong.

songs.full_title: Good Ones by Charli XCX
songs.title: Good Ones

description.plain:
“Good Ones” is the lead single of Charli XCX’s fifth studio album CRASH. The song was announced a month before its release. On her birthday, August 2, 2021, she revealed the cover art and tweeted:

my new song 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐧𝐞𝐬 arrives on September 2nd. get ready to surrender 🩸 pre save now. happy birthday to me 🖤⚰️🥀

Her message came with the single’s cover art which shows Charli posing in a 1980s-inspired outfit, reflecting the sonic direction of the album.

songs.full_title: ​party 4 u by Charli XCX
songs.title: ​party 4 u

description.plain:
Charli XCX played this song for the first time during her set with A. G. Cook at the Nylon Japan 13th anniversary party, May 26th 2017. https://youtu.be/SHFtZPkXjxc
In September of the same year, A. G. Cook played the song at H0L0 in Queens, NY.

In 2018, it was played at several of XCX’s Pop 2 afterparties, again by Cook.

On April 19th, 2020, XCX herself teased a new clip of the track, with new lyrics. On April 30th, she confirmed that the song will appear on the upcoming project how i’m feeling now.

songs.full_title: White Mercedes by Charli XCX
songs.title: White Mercedes

description.plain:
“White Mercedes” is the 9th track off of Charli XCX’s third studio album Charli.

The song’s demo leaked online in low quality in September 2018, which made fans skeptical that it would ever see an official release. However, the tracklist that was released June 13th 2019, confirmed the song would make it on to the album.

A high-quality version of the song’s demo leaked in August 2019, one month before the album’s release.

songs.full_title: Lipgloss by Charli XCX (Ft. ​cupcakKe)
songs.title: Lipgloss

description.plain:
“Lipgloss” refers to female arousal and oral sex, with the artists comparing the stickiness of their genitals to that of lipgloss. The raunchy and fun track is loaded with double entendres and sees Aitchison venture into more explicit territory more akin to the featuring artist’s previous releases.

The collaboration came around after a fan on Twitter asked if she’d like to work with CupcakKe, to which Aitchison responded:

omg i want to!!!! how do i get hold of [her]??????????

A couple of months later a remix of the track only featuring Aitchison’s vocals was performed at a nightclub by close collaborator SOPHIE, before the singer later confirmed during an Instagram livestream that the final track featured verses by CupcakKe.

songs.full_title: Next Level Charli by Charli XCX
songs.title: Next Level Charli

description.plain:
‘'Next Level Charli’‘ is the album opener for Charli by Charli XCX. The song was written by Charli and her longtime friend and collaborator, A. G. Cook who also produced this song.

In an Instagram Q&A, XCX described the song as “the perfect album opener” and as the anthem for her fans:

I dunno, I just feel like the lyrics in the song represent me and my fans and what we like to do and how we like to party.



Later, on Twitter, XCX said that the track was the one she was the most excited to play on her upcoming tour: https://twitter.com/charli_xcx/status/1162154599035224064?s=20

The track interpolates the melody of the first two verses from Mz. Bratt’s 2010 track “Selecta.” The instrumental heavily samples A. G. Cook’s 2015 remix of the track:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uY0vK67qdgI

songs.embed_content: Read “Next Level Charli” by Charli XCX on Genius
songs.recording_location: Vincent Ave. Los Angeles and PC Music Studios, London

songs.full_title: Out of My Head by Charli XCX (Ft. ALMA & Tove Lo)
songs.title: Out of My Head
songs.title_with_featured: Out of My Head (Ft. ALMA & Tove Lo)

description.plain:
“Out of My Head” was the first taste of Charli XCX’s  mixtape POP 2. It premiered on BBC Radio 1 on Wednesday, December 6th, 2017 with POP 2 being released the following week, on December 15th.

This electronic dance-pop track featuring Tove Lo and Alma is about partying to forget your problems. The three singers talk about dancing and doing drugs to distract themselves from a person who hurt them but who they still like and can’t forget.
